key_themes: Options dealer resistance zones limiting rallies
Labor market deterioration as cycle indicator
Rate cut accommodation vs recession signals
risk_factors: Unemployment trajectory continuing upward (4.6%) signaling cycle deterioration
Put-spread hedging for downside through 2026 indicating institutional concern
Earnings guidance cuts spreading from fintech/software to broader sectors
Options Call Walls creating technical resistance at SPY $681 and QQQ $615
Conflicting signals between bullish sentiment metrics and bearish professional positioning
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: $681 Call Wall active resistance (1.1% away), $670 Put Wall support (0.5% away). Watch $680 level (16k OI) as immediate barrier. QQQ: $610 resistance (1.1% away), $600 psychological support (0.6% away). Per Twitter: /ES 6800 critical resistance being defended by sellers.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Max Pain $670 gravitational pull into expiration. Call Wall $681 caps upside, breakdown below Put Wall $670 targets $665 support zone. QQQ: Max Pain $625 well above current price suggests downward bias. Put Wall $595 key support if $600 fails. Per Twitter: /ES consolidation bias testing 6800 support before any sustained rally attempt.
